Thoughts on Traceability
Thoughts on Traceability

Rüdiger Kessel NIST
Rüdiger Kessel
NIST

What Maketh a Measurement Device?
What Maketh a Measurement Device?

• A good measurement device has the following properties:
• A good measurement device has the following properties: • A
g o o d
m e a s u r e m e n t
d e v i c e
h a s
t h e
f o l l o w i n g
p r o p e r t i e s :

It is stable between calibrations It has a high resolution It has only very small deviations from linearity It has low noise (repeatable)
It is stable between calibrations
It has a high resolution
It has only very small deviations from linearity
It has low noise (repeatable)

1. 2. 3. 4. So it is stability, resolution, linearity and low noise the "makes" a measurement device. How "accurate" you can measure with it, depends on the actual calibration. All these properties can be verified without external reference (but with external reference the task is much easier).
1.
2.
3.
4.
So it is stability, resolution, linearity and low noise the "makes" a measurement
device. How "accurate" you can measure with it, depends on the actual
calibration. All these properties can be verified without external reference (but
with external reference the task is much easier).

• Only if these properties of the measurement device have been established, does
• Only if these properties of the measurement device have been established, does • O n l y
i f
t h e s e
p r o p e r t i e s
o f
t h e
m e a s u r e m e n t
d e v i c e
h a v e
b e e n
e s t a b l i s h e d ,
d o e s

it make sense to calibrate the instrument. So in the absence of a reliable traceability chain we should focus on these properties now. Adding a calibration factor later to the game is not a big deal.
it make sense to calibrate the instrument. So in the absence of a reliable
traceability chain we should focus on these properties now. Adding a calibration
factor later to the game is not a big deal.

Slide: 21 30 November 2020
Slide: 21
30 November 2020

Traceability Concepts
Traceability Concepts

The key issue in the traceability game is a way to prove that the
The key issue in the traceability game is a way to prove that the

system is indeed stable to a certain degree. On earth we simply re- calibrate to ensure this. Whatever has been done some time ago is meaningless until one can prove that the system is indeed in the very same state as during calibration.
system is indeed stable to a certain degree. On earth we simply re-
calibrate to ensure this. Whatever has been done some time ago is
meaningless until one can prove that the system is indeed in the
very same state as during calibration.

Instead of trying to construct SI traceable statements, we should recognize that:
Instead of trying to construct SI traceable statements, we should
recognize that:

1. SI traceability is not possible without regular re-calibration. 2. SI traceability need to be demonstrated 3. SI traceability is not needed to make results comparable 4. Stability is more important then traceability to SI
1. SI traceability is not possible without regular re-calibration.
2. SI traceability need to be demonstrated
3. SI traceability is not needed to make results comparable
4. Stability is more important then traceability to SI
